1.brief: to judge (officially or mentally); by extension, to intercede, pray
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

used only in plural the intestines, or (collectively) the abdomen, figuratively, sympathy; by implication, a vest; by extension the stomach, the uterus (or of men, the seat of generation), the heart (figuratively)

2.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

3.brief: to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
a deep place (of water or mud)
the heart (as the most interior organ);

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
something rolled, i.e. a heap of stone or dung (plural ruins), by analogy, a spring of water (plural waves)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

4.brief: to drive out from a possession; especially to expatriate or divorce
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
near, with or among; often in general, to
a large public building, such as a palace or temple
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

5.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
to wrap firmly (especially a turban, compress, or saddle); figuratively, to stop, to rule
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

6.brief: shape (as if cut out); base (as if there cut off)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

7.brief: to shroud, i.e. clothe (whether transitive or reflex.); hence (from the idea of darkness) to languish
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
near, with or among; often in general, to
a large public building, such as a palace or temple
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

8.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.

9.brief: properly, an extension of the hand, i.e. (by implication) avowal, or (usually) adoration; specifically, a choir of worshippers
to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to promise (pos., to do or give something to God)
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
